results_summary: The study protocol outlines a planned comparison of HIIT and HIIT combined with increased physical activity, but results are not yet available as it describes a future RCT.
population_specificity: Young sedentary women
effective_dosage: HIIT (3 sessions/week) and HIIT + PA (3 sessions/week + 10,000 steps/day)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the glycaemic effects of postprandial High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) in individuals with type 1 diabetes, focusing on blood glucose changes and hypoglycaemia occurrence.
results_summary: HIIT caused acute glycaemic declines, with the smallest effect size compared to other exercise modalities. Pre-exercise insulin reductions helped protect against hypoglycaemia, but nocturnal hypoglycaemia remained a risk after higher intensity exercise, which could be mitigated with post-exercise snacks and insulin adjustments.
population_specificity: Adults with type 1 diabetes.
interactions: Insulin adjustments (reductions) with pre- and post-exercise meals were noted to manage blood glucose levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) and Moderate-Intensity Continuous Training (MICT) on body composition and cardiorespiratory fitness in young and middle-aged individuals.
results_summary: Both HIIT and MICT improved body composition and cardiorespiratory fitness, except for fat-free mass. HIIT showed greater benefits for waist circumference, percent fat mass, and VO₂ compared to MICT, though clinical significance was limited. HIIT was noted as more time-efficient and enjoyable.
population_specificity: Young and middle-aged individuals (18-45 years), including those with obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of watt-controlled supramaximal High-Intensity Interval Training (HIT) versus Moderate-Intensity Training (MIT) on cardiorespiratory fitness, cognitive function, cardiovascular and muscular function, and quality of life in older adults.
results_summary: HIT improved cardiorespiratory fitness and cardiovascular function similarly to MIT despite requiring half the training time. HIT showed superior benefits in muscular function and working memory, though global cognition did not improve, and episodic memory declined slightly in both groups.
population_specificity: Nonexercising older adults aged 66-79 years (44% male).
effective_dosage: HIT—20-minute sessions (10 × 6-second intervals) twice weekly; MIT—40-minute sessions (3 × 8-minute intervals) twice weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the current state and trends in exercise interventions, including High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT), for sarcopenia over the past 20 years.
results_summary: The study identified "high-intensity interval training" as one of the six keyword clusters in exercise interventions for sarcopenia, indicating its relevance in the field. The abstract suggests that exercise, including HIIT, improves skeletal muscle mass, strength, and physical function in individuals with sarcopenia.
population_specificity: Individuals with sarcopenia (primarily older adults).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the quality and outcomes of different exercise regimes, including High-Intensity Interval Training, on polycystic ovary syndrome symptoms and determine if one regime was superior.
results_summary: High-Intensity Interval Training, along with other exercise regimes, improved polycystic ovary syndrome symptoms by addressing risk factors like insulin resistance, body morphology, and quality of life, though no single regime was conclusively better.
population_specificity: Individuals with polycystic ovary syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the HIIT protocol parameters that elicit peak lactate levels and how these levels are associated with post-HIIT cognitive performance.
results_summary: The study found that a HIIT protocol with low total work-interval volume (~5 min), recovery intervals five times longer than work intervals, and medium session volume (~15 min) elicited peak lactate levels. Lactate levels post-HIIT explained 14-17% of variance in cognitive performance (Stroop interference condition) at 30 min post-exercise.
population_specificity: Healthy adults (mean age 24.1 ± 4.7 years)
effective_dosage: Example protocol: 8 × 30-s maximal intensity with 90-s recovery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of acute and chronic high-intensity interval training (HIIT) and sprint interval training (SIT) on cognitive function related to work performance in adults.
results_summary: The study found that 55% of acute training studies and 38% of chronic training studies showed significant improvements in cognitive functions like attention, memory, and reaction time, but only four studies tested these effects in workplace settings.
population_specificity: Adults (n = 11-945 participants across 15 countries)
effective_dosage: HIIT (70%-100% VO2max) and SIT protocols (specific dosage not detailed)
study_duration: Varied (acute: single session; chronic: multiple sessions)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) on hypertension-induced microvascular remodeling in hypertensive patients compared to healthy controls.
results_summary: Hypertensive patients showed thicker arteriolar retinal vessel walls and higher wall-to-lumen ratios than healthy controls. After eight weeks of supervised HIIT, the intervention group demonstrated significant reductions in arteriolar retinal vessel wall thickness and wall-to-lumen ratio compared to the control group, independent of blood pressure changes or cardiorespiratory fitness.
population_specificity: 41 hypertensive patients on anti-hypertensive medication and 19 normotensive healthy controls.
effective_dosage: Supervised and walking-based HIIT (specific frequency/intensity not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of date seeds powder (DSP) during HIIT sessions on inflammation markers, oxidants/antioxidants, muscle damage, and body composition.
results_summary: DSP supplementation during HIIT significantly reduced inflammation and muscle damage markers while increasing total antioxidant capacity, but had no significant effect on BDNF, interleukin-10, or body composition.
population_specificity: 36 recreational runners (men and women), aged 18-35 years.
effective_dosage: 26 g/day of DSP or wheat bran powder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the anti-inflammatory effects of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) and moderate-to-vigorous intensity continuous training (MICT) in male patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), with or without type 2 diabetes (T2D).
results_summary: Both HIIT and MICT similarly reduced circulating inflammatory cytokines in CAD patients, with more pronounced reductions in FGF21 and IL-6 in T2D patients. HIIT increased SPARC in non-T2D patients but decreased it in T2D patients, while MICT had the opposite effect.
population_specificity: Male patients with CAD, with or without T2D (non-T2D-HIIT n=14, non-T2D-MICT n=13; T2D-HIIT n=6, T2D-MICT n=5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) and Moderate-Intensity Continuous Training (MICT) on vascular function and repair in patients with Heart Failure with Preserved Ejection Fraction (HFpEF).
results_summary: The study found that neither HIIT nor MICT significantly improved vascular function or levels of endothelium-repairing cells in HFpEF patients after 3 or 12 months of training. Abnormal vascular parameters at baseline remained unchanged post-intervention, even in patients with high adherence to the training programs.
population_specificity: Patients with Heart Failure with Preserved Ejection Fraction (HFpEF) (n = 180).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) on sleep quality in women with PCOS and its associations with anthropometric and cardiometabolic health markers.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant changes in sleep quality with HIIT, though reductions in body weight and waist circumference were associated with decreases in sleep efficiency scores among HIIT participants. Most participants had poor sleep quality at baseline, which correlated with poorer health markers.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-40 years with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of an 8-week walking-based, supervised HIIT on macro- and microvascular endothelial function in patients with arterial hypertension.
results_summary: The HIIT group showed improvements in microvascular endothelial function (arteriolar FID) and reduced body fat and visceral fat, but no changes in macrovascular function (FMD) or blood pressure. The control group only reduced diastolic blood pressure and showed no microvascular improvements.
population_specificity: Forty patients (mean age 58 ± 7 years) with arterial hypertension.
effective_dosage: 3 sessions per week (specific intensity/duration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of HIIT and MICT on inhibition in executive function in healthy individuals to inform exercise practice and health interventions.
results_summary: Both HIIT and MICT improved inhibition function in healthy people, but no significant difference was found between the two exercise modalities in terms of improvement effect. The study included 285 subjects across eight studies, analyzing correct rate and response time indicators.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals, including teenagers, young adults, and the elderly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of eight treadmill high-intensity interval training (HIT) sessions on carbohydrate and lipid oxidation rates and ventilatory anaerobic thresholds in women during different phases of the monthly ovarian cycle.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in VATs intensities between groups but observed significant changes in substrate oxidation rates, with HIT minimizing differences in carbohydrate oxidation and increasing lipid oxidation post-training.
population_specificity: Eleven irregularly active women of childbearing age.
effective_dosage: Eight treadmill HIT sessions (specific intensity/duration not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (implied by eight sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if high-intensity interval training (HIIT) could provide greater improvements in mental health outcomes compared to moderate-intensity continuous training (MICT) in women with PCOS.
results_summary: The study compared HIIT and MICT in overweight women with PCOS but did not report specific results in the provided abstract.
population_specificity: Overweight women with PCOS aged 18-45 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the feasibility and preliminary efficacy of a home-based HIIT intervention on physical activity in low-active adults.
results_summary: The HIIT intervention was feasible based on retention, recruitment, and adherence. HIIT participants reported increased vigorous physical activity at six weeks (but not at 12 weeks) and higher self-efficacy, enjoyment, and engagement with physical activity compared to controls.
population_specificity: Low-active adults (n = 47)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different aerobic training protocols, including high-intensity interval training (HIIT), on cardiometabolic variables in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: Low-volume HIIT showed greater improvements in cardiorespiratory capacity compared to low-volume moderate-intensity continuous training (MICT). High-intensity protocols, especially L-HIIT, demonstrated the most evident benefits, though no other significant differences were found between groups.
population_specificity: 44 men and women with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), aged over 40 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness and safety of low-volume HIIT versus moderate-intensity steady-state (MISS) exercise for people with coronary artery disease (CAD) in cardiac rehabilitation.
results_summary: HIIT improved cardiorespiratory fitness (VO2 peak) significantly more than MISS, with a clinically meaningful difference. HIIT was found to be safe and well-tolerated, with only one serious adverse event possibly related to the intervention.
population_specificity: People with stable coronary artery disease (CAD) attending outpatient cardiac rehabilitation.
effective_dosage: HIIT consisted of 10 × 1 min intervals of vigorous exercise (>85% maximum capacity) interspersed with 1 min recovery periods, administered twice weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intensive exercise (not specifically High-Intensity Interval Training) improves physical function, mobility, independence in ADLs, and reduces hospital stay duration in older adults post-hip fracture surgery.
results_summary: Intensive exercise improved physical function, gait speed, timed up-and-go test results, balance, and ADLs more than regular or no exercise, though the evidence quality was low due to bias and inconsistency.
population_specificity: Older adults who underwent hip fracture surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility of a high-intensity interval training (HIIT) intervention in individuals with acute spinal cord injury (SCI) to improve cardiometabolic health.
results_summary: The study assessed the feasibility of conducting a full RCT for HIIT in acute SCI patients, measuring cardiorespiratory fitness, glycaemic control, lipid profile, and body habitus, but specific efficacy results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Individuals with acute spinal cord injury (<6 months post-injury) attending inpatient rehabilitation.
effective_dosage: Supervised HIIT on an arm cycle ergometer three times per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Ramadan diurnal intermittent fasting (RDIF) alone versus RDIF combined with concurrent training (RDIF-CT) on body composition, metabolic, and inflammatory biomarkers in obese men.
results_summary: The study found that RDIF-CT led to greater improvements in body composition, lipid profile, inflammation, and liver biomarkers compared to RDIF alone.
population_specificity: Obese men (age: 31.8 ± 7.05 years, BMI: 33.1 ± 4.2 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects and safety of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) to inform treatment and care strategies.
results_summary: HIIT improved peak oxygen consumption, minute ventilation, work rate, 6-minute walking distance, quality of life, and reduced dyspnea in COPD patients, but showed no significant effects on forced expiratory volume or St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire scores. The study concluded HIIT is beneficial for COPD treatment.
population_specificity: 962 COPD patients across 20 randomized controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) on non-exercise physical activity (NEPA) and estimated thermogenesis (NEAT) in individuals with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) on non-training days, as well as differences between low-responders and high-responders to exercise-induced body weight and fat mass reductions.
results_summary: The study found no compensatory changes in estimated NEAT or NEPA with HIIT on non-training days compared to controls. Additionally, no differences were observed between low-responders and high-responders in these measures.
population_specificity: Individuals with type 2 diabetes mellitus (n=56 with complete data from an initial 80 participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether early initiation of home-based HIIT could improve cardiorespiratory fitness, physical activity, and reduce recurrent stroke risk in post-stroke patients.
results_summary: HIIT did not improve long-term cardiorespiratory fitness but temporarily increased vigorous-intensity activity post-stroke, though levels declined to baseline by 12 months. Secondary outcomes improved over time with no significant differences between HIIT and usual care groups.
population_specificity: Patients with lacunar stroke (mean age 63.9 ± 8.8 years).
effective_dosage: Three-month HIIT intervention with weekly motivational calls.
study_duration: Three months (with follow-up at six and 12 months).

study_goal: To evaluate the feasibility, safety, physiological, and clinical effects of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) for people with Parkinson's disease (PwP).
results_summary: HIIT was found to be feasible and safe for people with mild-to-moderate Parkinson's disease, improving cardiorespiratory fitness (VO₂) and potentially increasing BDNF levels and motor symptom improvement. Adverse events were uncommon, and program completion rates were high (90-100%).
population_specificity: People with mild-to-moderate Parkinson's disease (PwP).
study_duration: Between 6 weeks and 24 months (most studies ≤12 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cardiovascular autonomic control benefits of HIIT versus MICT in women with PCOS.
results_summary: HIIT and MICT showed similar improvements in baseline heart rate, testosterone levels, and VO2, suggesting both protocols are effective for PCOS treatment. No significant differences were found between the two training methods for the evaluated parameters.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of six weeks of HIIT and L-Arginine supplementation on interleukin-6 (IL-6) levels and body composition in trained adult males.
results_summary: HIIT alone did not significantly affect body composition indices (BMI, BFP, LBM). However, plasma IL-6 levels decreased significantly in the "HIIT + L-Arginine supplementation" and "HIIT + placebo" groups compared to the HIIT-only and L-Arginine-only groups, suggesting HIIT may reduce inflammation.
population_specificity: Iranian adult trained males from Qazvin province (48 participants, aged not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 6 months of supervised high-intensity interval training (HIIT) could reduce coronary atheroma volume in patients with stable coronary artery disease (CAD) following percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
results_summary: The study found that HIIT significantly reduced percent atheroma volume (PAV) and total atheroma volume (TAV) compared to a control group following standard preventive guidelines, indicating that HIIT counteracts atherosclerotic progression in residual plaques post-PCI.
population_specificity: Patients with stable CAD who had undergone PCI.
effective_dosage: Two sessions per week at 85-95% of peak heart rate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of an 8-week online HIIT program on anaerobic threshold parameters, body weight, and body composition in pregnant women.
results_summary: The HIIT group maintained anaerobic threshold parameters despite pregnancy progression, reduced fat mass percentage, and improved fat-free mass percentage, while the EDU group showed deterioration in these parameters. The HIIT program prevented excessive weight gain and exercise capacity reduction without adverse obstetric or neonatal outcomes.
population_specificity: 69 Caucasian women with uncomplicated singleton pregnancies (age: 31 ± 4 years; gestational age: 22 ± 5 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) and moderate-intensity continuous training (MICT) on blood pressure and vascular function in patients with essential hypertension.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between HIIT and MICT in improving overall resting systolic and diastolic blood pressure, but HIIT was more effective in reducing daytime systolic blood pressure and improving flow-mediated vasodilation.
population_specificity: Patients with essential hypertension and prehypertension (442 participants across 13 randomized controlled trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine blood glucose responses to High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIE) in adults with type 1 diabetes (T1D) and identify predictors of these responses.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found an inconsistent effect of HIIE on blood glucose, with an overall mean decrease of -1.3 mmol/L, though results were highly heterogeneous. Prandial status partially explained the variability in blood glucose responses.
population_specificity: Adults (mean age >18 years) with type 1 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) in pulmonary prehabilitation programs for reducing postoperative pulmonary complications, particularly in patients awaiting thoracic surgery.
results_summary: The study found that HIIT administered for 1-2 weeks showed similar rates of improved postoperative outcomes compared to longer endurance training programs (8-12 weeks), making it a viable option for patients awaiting thoracic surgery, especially cancer resection. The shorter duration of HIIT may be more practical for these patients.
population_specificity: Patients awaiting thoracic surgery, particularly for cancer resection.
effective_dosage: Not specified (HIIT duration mentioned as 1-2 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of low-volume high-intensity interval training (LVHIIT) on metabolic and cardiorespiratory outcomes in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: LVHIIT significantly improved fasting blood glucose, HbA1c, insulin resistance (HOMA-IR), body mass, BMI, blood lipid metabolism, systolic blood pressure, and peak oxygen uptake in T2DM patients, though fasting insulin changes were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of 10-week HIIT spinning bike exercise on the severity of primary dysmenorrhea, physiological modulation, and physical fitness in university students.
results_summary: The study found that HIIT significantly reduced premenstrual symptoms, menstrual distress, and pain severity, likely through hormone modulation and down-regulation of inflammatory markers (HsCRP, PGE2, PGF2α). Participants also showed improved cardiovascular endurance and explosive force after the intervention.
population_specificity: University students with primary dysmenorrhea.
effective_dosage: Training intensity was validated by heart rate monitors and BORG rating of perceived exertion (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the safety, feasibility, and efficacy of 12-weeks of supervised HIIT compared with a sham-exercise control for improving aerobic fitness and peripheral insulin sensitivity in people with biopsy-proven NASH.
results_summary: HIIT was found to be safe with no adverse events, feasible with high adherence rates, and efficacious for improving exercise capacity and peripheral insulin sensitivity in people with NASH. A large between-group effect was observed for exercise capacity.
population_specificity: Adults with biopsy-proven NASH (n=14, mean age 56±10 years, BMI 39.2±6.7 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Not specified (supervised HIIT sessions with adherence to session 95.4±7.3%, interval intensity 95.3±6.0%, and duration 96.8±2.4%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a 12-week combined exercise program, including HIIT, on pain, fatigue, quality of life, and vascular structure in patients with systemic sclerosis (SSc).
results_summary: The study will evaluate the effectiveness of HIIT combined with resistance training on pain and fatigue in SSc patients, with secondary outcomes including quality of life, microvascular structure, and physical fitness. Results are pending as the study is ongoing.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic sclerosis (SSc) (n = 180).
effective_dosage: Two 45-minute sessions per week (30 minutes HIIT at 100% peak power output with 30-second intervals, plus 15 minutes of upper body resistance training).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high-intensity exercise training would inhibit platelet aggregation, reduce thrombin generation, and enhance fibrinolysis in patients with coronary artery disease (CAD).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between the exercise and standard care groups in platelet aggregation, thrombin generation, or fibrinolysis after 12 weeks of high-intensity endurance exercise.
population_specificity: Stable patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), predominantly male (83%), average age 67±9 years.
effective_dosage: Supervised high-intensity exercise training program (specific dosage not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a novel HIIT protocol involving both lower and upper body muscles improves insulin sensitivity, metabolic health, and adherence in obese men with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that the HIIT protocol significantly improved insulin sensitivity (measured by glucose disposal rate) and VO2max in obese men with type 2 diabetes, with no adverse effects on adherence.
population_specificity: Obese men with type 2 diabetes and age-matched obese non-diabetic controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 20-week high-intensity aerobic and resistance training (HIART) program could increase total lean soft tissue mass in middle-aged adults with low relative lean soft tissue mass compared to a control group.
results_summary: The HIART program effectively increased total lean soft tissue mass in middle-aged adults with low relative lean soft tissue mass compared to the control group, which only received an education session. Secondary outcomes, including cardiorespiratory fitness and physical function, were also measured but not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Middle-aged adults (40-50 years) with low appendicular lean soft tissue mass index, predominantly female.
effective_dosage: Group-based, three times a week, high-intensity aerobic and resistance training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effects of aerobic exercise, particularly High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT), on non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including its advanced stages like steatohepatitis and liver fibrosis.
results_summary: HIIT showed a non-significant reduction in ALT (-4.31, p=0.07) and no significant effect on AST (1.02, p=0.8), but significantly reduced liver fat (-3.41, p<0.001) compared to controls. Both HIIT and MICT improved liver fat and cardiorespiratory fitness, though HIIT's effects on liver enzymes were less consistent.
population_specificity: 1014 patients with NAFLD diagnosed by histological or radiological findings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ACE inhibition affects the muscular adaptations induced by systematic aerobic exercise training, specifically high-intensity whole-body exercise.
results_summary: Eight weeks of high-intensity whole-body exercise improved markers of skeletal muscle mitochondrial oxidative capacity, glycolytic capacity, and angiogenesis, with no significant effect from ACE inhibition in healthy adults.
population_specificity: Healthy, untrained, middle-aged participants (40 ± 7 years).

study_goal: To determine the effects of COVID-19 social confinement on cardiometabolic health benefits acquired through a concurrent training programme (HIIT + resistance training) in morbidly obese women.
results_summary: The study found that COVID-19 social confinement worsened metabolic syndrome outcomes (e.g., waist circumference, systolic blood pressure, triglycerides) that had improved during the 20-week training period, with systolic blood pressure increasing to a more serious clinical classification in both groups.
population_specificity: Sedentary morbidly obese women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of 12 weeks of HIIT and MICT-based cardiovascular rehabilitation on functional capacity and quality of life in patients with persistent and permanent AF.
results_summary: The study found that HIIT was as effective as MICT in improving functional capacity, general and disease-specific quality of life, resting heart rate, and physical activity levels in AF patients, with no significant differences between the two interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with persistent and permanent atrial fibrillation (mean age 69 years, 66.3% male).
effective_dosage: HIIT (23 minutes: two 8-minute interval training blocks of 30-second work periods at 80%-100% of peak power output interspersed with 30-second recovery) twice weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high-intensity interval training (HIIT) improves aerobic capacity, fatigue, and immune system markers in patients with prostate cancer.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that HIIT improved aerobic capacity, fatigue, and PSA levels in prostate cancer patients but did not significantly affect IL-6 or TNF-α levels.
population_specificity: 215 male prostate cancer patients with a mean age of 64.4 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if teacher-delivered HIIT with Indigenous narrative options improved mental health in school students compared to standard physical education.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of HIIT on self-perceived psychological difficulty or mental wellbeing in young adolescents. Teachers struggled to consistently deliver Indigenous narratives due to preparation challenges and lack of confidence.
population_specificity: School students aged 11-13 years in low-mid socioeconomic areas (N=368).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two different concurrent training regimens (power training + HIIT vs. traditional strength training + HIIT) on neuromuscular, cardiorespiratory, and functional outcomes in older men.
results_summary: The study compared PT + HIIT and TST + HIIT but did not report specific outcomes for HIIT alone. The abstract mentions assessments of maximal dynamic strength (1RM) and rate of force development (RFD), but full results are not provided.
population_specificity: Older men (65.8 ± 3.9 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the feasibility and impact of 12 weeks of low-volume high-intensity interval training (HIIT) on cardiorespiratory performance and quality of life in patients with stable coronary artery disease (CAD).
results_summary: The study found that 12 weeks of supervised HIIT improved cardiorespiratory performance and quality of life in CAD patients compared to standard care, as measured by physiological evaluations and questionnaires. Mixed model analysis confirmed significant differences between and within groups.
population_specificity: Patients with stable coronary artery disease (CAD), average age 67 ± 9 years.
effective_dosage: Three HIIT sessions weekly on a rowing ergometer (specific intensity/volume not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether post-session protein supplementation enhances the cardiometabolic benefits of low-volume high-intensity interval training (LOW-HIIT) in sedentary healthy individuals.
results_summary: LOW-HIIT improved VO2max and other cardiometabolic markers, but protein supplementation did not provide additional benefits compared to placebo. Both groups showed similar improvements in blood pressure and liver enzymes, with no significant between-group differences.
population_specificity: Sedentary healthy individuals (mean age 31.1 ± 8.0 years).
effective_dosage: 40 g of whey protein or maltodextrin placebo after each session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) with blood flow restriction (BFR) could more effectively reduce abdominal visceral fat and improve glucose metabolism in obese adults compared to HIIT alone.
results_summary: The study found that HIIT with BFR was more effective than HIIT alone in reducing body fat levels and improving glucose metabolism. Applying BFR during the interval phase of HIIT was particularly effective in reducing abdominal visceral fat, likely due to increased lipolytic hormone levels from higher physiological load.
population_specificity: 72 obese adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two interval training protocols (HIIT and SIT) on cardiac autonomic modulation in healthy women.
results_summary: The study found that eight weeks of interval training improved cardiac autonomic modulation, with the HIIT group showing better results for certain variables (0V patterns) compared to the SIT group.
population_specificity: Healthy women with a mean age of 29.96 ± 6.25 years.
effective_dosage: HIIT: four four-minute high-intensity sprints with three minutes of active recovery; SIT: four 30-second all-out sprints with four minutes of recovery (active or passive).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a single bout of High-Intensity Interval Training could modulate tumor oxygenation and immune cell infiltration in patients with prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in tumor hypoxia or natural killer (NK) cell infiltration between the exercise and control groups, suggesting that a single exercise bout is insufficient to impact these outcomes. No correlation was observed between microvessel density (MVD) and tumor hypoxia or NK cell infiltration.
population_specificity: Thirty patients with localized prostate cancer scheduled for radical prostatectomy.
effective_dosage: One bout of High-Intensity Interval Training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze molecular changes in skeletal muscle of patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction performing different exercise training modalities, including High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT).
results_summary: HIIT improved markers of energy metabolism and the amount/function of satellite cells, with minor changes in muscle atrophy markers after 3 months, but these benefits were lost after 12 months. Exercise capacity improved initially with both HIIT and moderate continuous training but did not persist long-term.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction.
effective_dosage: Not specified (supervised in-hospital HIIT for 3 months, followed by 9 months home-based).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of low-volume exercise modalities, including High-Intensity Interval Training (LOW-HIIT), on inflammatory and cardiometabolic outcomes in patients with metabolic syndrome (MetS).
results_summary: LOW-HIIT significantly reduced inflammatory markers (CRP, interleukin-6) and improved MetS severity scores, demonstrating superior efficacy for inflammation compared to other low-volume exercises like 1-RT and WB-EMS. Resistance-based exercises required higher volume (3-RT) to show similar benefits on inflammation.
population_specificity: 106 MetS patients (average age 53.7 ± 11.4 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) could effectively promote neuroplasticity and improve cardiovascular health in individuals with chronic stroke compared to Moderate-Intensity Continuous Training (MICT).
results_summary: The study is designed to assess corticospinal excitability (a neuroplasticity marker) and other outcomes like cardiovascular health, motor function, and psychosocial responses. Results are pending as the abstract describes the trial design rather than final findings.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic stroke.
effective_dosage: HIIT or MICT on a recumbent stepper, 3 days per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exercise training (ET) could improve endothelial dysfunction in postmenopausal women with AI-treated breast cancer.
results_summary: The study found that supervised ET significantly improved maximal exercise capacity compared to usual care, but it did not measurably affect endothelial dysfunction as measured by RHI.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women with aromatase inhibitor-treated breast cancer.
study_duration: 6 months of supervised training plus 6 months without intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) on lipid content in coronary plaques in patients with stable coronary artery disease after percutaneous coronary intervention.
results_summary: The study randomized 60 patients to either supervised HIIT or a control group for 6 months, measuring changes in lipid content using near-infrared spectroscopy. The primary endpoint was the change in maximum lipid core burden index at 4 mm (maxLCBI).
population_specificity: Patients with stable coronary artery disease following percutaneous coronary intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a 6-month school-based High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) intervention on hippocampal metabolism in lower-fit older adolescents.
results_summary: The study found that the HIIT intervention (Burn 2 Learn) led to significant increases in N-acetylaspartate (NAA) and glutamate+glutamine (Glx) concentrations in the left hippocampus, which were associated with improvements in cardiorespiratory fitness.
population_specificity: Lower-fit older adolescents (N=56, 61% female, 16.1±0.4 years) from four secondary schools in New South Wales, Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of different exercise training modalities, including HIIT, on heart rate variability (HRV) and their association with health-related outcomes in sedentary middle-aged adults.
results_summary: All exercise modalities, including HIIT and HIIT+EMS, improved HRV parameters without significant differences between groups. Changes in HRV were associated with improvements in body composition and cardiometabolic risk.
population_specificity: Sedentary middle-aged adults (53.6 ± 4.4 years old; 50% women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of HIIT combined with fasting versus other interventions (HIIT alone, fasting alone, or normal intervention) on body composition and VO₂ max in overweight and obese adults.
results_summary: HIIT + fasting showed better effects on body mass, waist circumference, fat mass, and VO₂ max compared to control groups, though the GRADE of evidence was very low due to the small number of included trials.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining the Mediterranean diet with HIIT could improve cardiorespiratory fitness, body composition, and quality of life in men undergoing androgen deprivation therapy for prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean diet combined with HIIT significantly improved cardiorespiratory fitness (+4.9 mL·kg−1·min) and reduced body mass (−3.3 kg) compared to usual care. Clinically meaningful improvements were also observed in quality of life and cancer-related fatigue.
population_specificity: Men with prostate cancer receiving androgen deprivation therapy (mean age 65.9 ± 7.8 years, BMI 29.6 ± 2.7 kg/m², ADT duration 33.8 ± 35.6 months).
effective_dosage: HIIT protocol: 4 × 4 min at 85−95% heart rate peak, 3 times per week (starting at 12 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a 5-year exercise intervention, including High-Intensity Interval Training, on the structural complexity of the brain in healthy older adults.
results_summary: The study measured changes in brain structural complexity (fractal dimension) and cardiorespiratory fitness over 5 years, comparing High-Intensity Interval Training with moderate-intensity continuous training and a control group, but specific results for HIIT were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 105 healthy older adults participating in the Generation 100 Study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of school-based HIIT interventions in improving health outcomes for children and adolescents compared to control groups or other exercise modalities, and to explore intervention characteristics and process outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that HIIT significantly improved waist circumference, body fat percentage, BMI, cardiorespiratory fitness, resting heart rate, insulin resistance, and LDL cholesterol compared to control groups, but results were mixed when compared to other exercise modalities.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 5-17 years in school settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the metabolic changes and clinical benefits of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) without dietary modifications.
results_summary: HIIT significantly improved fasting plasma glucose, waist circumference, oxygen consumption, and workload, while inducing sample-specific metabolic changes, particularly in adipose tissue, plasma, urine, and stool. The intervention also highlighted altered amino acid metabolism in adipose tissue as a potential mechanism for improved glucose control.
population_specificity: 46 subjects with NAFLD (21 in the intervention group, 25 in the control group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (HIIT protocol details not provided in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether one year of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) and omega-3 fatty acid supplementation could improve fitness, cardiovascular structure/function, and body composition in obese middle-aged adults at high risk of heart failure (stage A).
results_summary: HIIT improved exercise capacity by ~24% and enhanced cardiovascular structure/function, but had no detectable effect on visceral fat or myocardial triglyceride content. Omega-3 fatty acid supplementation showed no independent or additive benefits.
population_specificity: Obese middle-aged adults (40-55 years) at high risk of heart failure (stage A) with elevated biomarkers (N-terminal pro-B-type natriuretic peptide >40 pg/mL or high-sensitivity cardiac troponin T >0.6 pg/mL) and visceral fat >2 kg.
effective_dosage: Not specified for HIIT; omega-3 supplementation was 1.6 g/day of omega-3-acid ethyl esters.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of different exercise training programs, including High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT), on fasting plasma levels of oxylipins, endocannabinoids (eCBs), and eCBs-like molecules in middle-aged sedentary adults.
results_summary: The study found that a 12-week HIIT intervention did not significantly modify fasting plasma levels of omega-6 and omega-3 oxylipins, eCBs, and eCBs-like molecules compared to the control group, though some changes in specific molecules (anandamide and oleoylethanolamide) were noted in the physical activity recommendations group.
population_specificity: Middle-aged sedentary adults (40-65 years old).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 12 weeks of HIIT resulted in greater improvements in cardio-metabolic and reproductive outcomes compared to standard MICT in women with PCOS.
results_summary: HIIT led to greater improvements in aerobic capacity, insulin sensitivity, and menstrual cyclicity, as well as larger reductions in hyperandrogenism compared to MICT. Both interventions improved VO2peak, but HIIT showed superior efficacy in multiple outcomes.
population_specificity: Overweight women aged 18-45 with PCOS and no co-existing comorbidities requiring medication.
effective_dosage: HIIT (>90% peak heart rate, three times per week).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relative effectiveness of High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) compared to other exercise interventions in improving aerobic capacity (VO₂ peak) in patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF).
results_summary: HIIT showed significant improvement in VO₂ peak (SMD 3.5, 95% CI 2.6-4.4), ranking second only to inspiratory muscle training. It was identified as one of the top three most effective physical rehabilitation interventions for enhancing aerobic capacity in HFpEF patients.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether high-intensity interval training could mobilize and increase immune cell infiltration into the tumor microenvironment in patients with non-small cell lung cancer, potentially enhancing immunotherapy effects.
results_summary: The study found that exercise may increase immune cell infiltration (particularly NK cells) into tumors, altering the tumor microenvironment and potentially reducing tumor growth, based on prior mouse model data. The clinical trial (HI AIM) is ongoing to confirm these effects in humans.
population_specificity: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer
effective_dosage: Supervised and group-based high-intensity interval training three times per week

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a school-based high-intensity interval training intervention on body composition, cardiorespiratory fitness, and cardiometabolic markers in obese boys aged 10 to 13 years.
results_summary: The study found that the training program led to decreased BMI and body fat mass, suggesting improvements in physical health for obese adolescents. Further research with larger and more diverse cohorts was recommended.
population_specificity: Obese adolescent boys aged 10 to 13 years.
